metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43680 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libexpat through 2.4.9, there is a use-after free caused by overeager destruction of a shared DTD in XML_ExternalEntityParserCreate in out-of-memory situations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.6
libexpat1 - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!) mdeslaur> apache2 uses system expat apr-util uses system expat cmake uses system expat ghostscript uses system expat

criterions.comment: cadaver package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-1ubuntu0.6').
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
libxmltok package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.

wbxml2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
